Name: Maximal onset
Description: How many C are allowed in the onset of a syllable

Name: Maximal coda
Description: How many C are allowed in the coda of a syllable

Name: CV language
Description: Whether the language maximally allows CV syllables

Name: CVC language
Description: Whether the language maximally allows CVC syllables

Name: CCV language
Description: Whether the language maximally allows CCV syllables

Name: CCVC language
Description: Whether the language maximally allows CCVC syllables

Name: Are zero onsets allowed?
Description: Whether the language allows null onsets

Name: Codas require onsets
Description: Whether the presence of an onset can be predicted from the presence of a coda

Name: Onset second C is preferentially glide
Description: Whether the second consonant is preferentially a glide

Name: Any Glides?
Description: Does the language have glides?

Name: Onset second C = y
Description: C2 glide is preferentially palatal?

Name: Onset second C = w
Description: C2 glide is preferentially labiovelar?

Name: Onset second C is preferentially liquid
Description: Whether the second C is preferentially a liquid

Name: Any rhotics?
Description: Does the language have rhotics?

Name: Any laterals?
Description: Does the language have laterals?

Name: Liquid = r(-like)
Description: C2 liquid is preferentially rhotic?

Name: Liquid = ell(-like)
Description: C2 liquid is preferentially lateral?

Name: Coda = p t k glottal
Description: Whether the code is preferentially a voiceless stop, such as [p], [t], [k] or [_]

Name: Coda = glottal stop
Description: Whether the coda is preferentially a glottal stop

Name: Palatals/Affricates (ts, c etc.) allowed as coda
Description: Whether the code can be [ts]~[t]~[c]: some sort of post-coronal, pre-velar plosive

Name: Coda = nasal
Description: Whether the coda is preferentially a nasal

Name: Coda = ng
Description: Whether the coda is preferentially a velar stop

Name: Coda = r l
Description: Whether the coda is preferentially a liquid

Name: Coda = s
Description: Whether the code is preferentially [s]

Name: Coda = glide
Description: Whether the code is preferentially a glide

Name: C1 in a CC coda = nasal
Description: Whether C1 in a coda of the form C1C2 C1 is preferentially nasal

Name: C1 in a CC coda = liquid
Description: Whether C1 in a coda of the form C1C2 C1 is preferentially liquid

Name: C1 in a CC coda = glide
Description: Whether C1 in coda of the form C1C2 C1 is preferentially glide

Name: C1 in a CC coda = glottal stop
Description: Whether C1 in a coda of the form C1C2 C1 is preferentially a glottal stop

Name: C2 in a CC coda = s
Description: Whether C2 in a coda of the form C1C2 C1 is preferentially /s/

Name: Sesquisyllabic epenthesis
Description: Whether the language displays epenthesis between two initial consonants

Name: General epenthesis
Description: Whether the language generally epenthesises vowels between two adjacent consonants

Name: Syllabic consonants
Description: Whether the language allows syllabic consonants

Name: Syllabic nasals
Description: Whether the language allows syllabic nasals

Name: Syllabic non-nasals
Description: Whether the language allows syllabic consonants other than nasals

Name: Glottal stops in onsets?
Description: Whether a glottal stop can occur in an onset

Name: Glottal stops in codas?
Description: Whether a glottal stop can occur in a coda

Name: Velar nasals in onsets?
Description: Whether a velar nasal can occur in an onset

Name: Velar nasals in codas?
Description: Whether a velar nasal can occur in a coda

Name: Supralaryngeal Plosive series
Description: Includes contrasting affricate series

Name: How many coronal stop places (oral) are there?
How many coronal affricate series are there?
t more front than d?
Description: Voiceless coronal stop more front than voiced counterpart?

Name: d more front than t?
Description: Voiced coronal stop more front than voiceless counterpart?

Name: How many coronal nasal places are there?
Interior vowel system (contains schwa, barred-i etc.)
